sect2.title: Introduction to libusb
sect2.para: The libusb package contains a library used by some applications for USB device access.

sect2.title: Configuring libusb
sect2.para: libusb requires the usbfs kernel filesystem to be mounted on /proc/bus/usb. Applications require the files in this directory to be accessible to the user, sometimes for both reading and writing. To restrict access to USB devices, ensure the usb group exits on your system. sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The libusb package contains libusb libraries, the /usr/include/usb.h header, and a usb-config script.

sect3.title: libusb libraries
sect3.para: libusb libraries contain C functions for accessing USB hardware.

sect3.title: usb-config
sect3.para: The usb-config script provides the right compiler and linker flags for programs using this library.
